section.title: NAME
section.p: count - Return the total amount of records in a specified collection in a collection space.

section.title: DESCRIPTION
section.p: Return the total amount of records in a specified collection in a collection space.

plentry.pd:
Selecting condition. If it is null, it will count all the records in the collection. If it is not null, it will count records that match the conditions.
Format The method "count()" contains field named "cond". It is a JSON object. {[{"Field name 1":{"match 1":"value 1"},"Field name 2":{"match 2":"value 2"},...}]}

section.title: Examples
section.p: Count all the records in collection "bar" without specifying "cond".
Count records that both contain the value "Tom" on the field "name" and the value on the field "age" is greater than 25.
